attributes.action: Allow secondary schools for pupils to have nose studs in.
attributes.additional_details: Wearing nose piercings in secondary school doesn't impact learning. It's all about expressing personal style and identity/culture while still focusing on their academics. Nose piercings don't interfere with a student's ability to listen, participate, or understand the material. As long as students are respectful and maintain good hygiene, they should be able to wear their nose piercings and excel in their studies at the same time.
attributes.background: It shouldn’t affect anyone’s learning, it also irritates their noses. I believe this is discriminating the right of personal freedom and individual rights. Teachers shouldn’t have a reason to pick children who have spent their own money for their nose piercings as it is not affecting anyone.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about jewellery students can wear at school are a matter for individual schools, not the UK Government or Parliament.
